comments: 3 is the only integer value of k for which [n^k/k^n] is always positive. For positive real x and k, the only value of k for which x^k is always greater than or equal to k^x is e=2.71828...
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,200
prog: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 50); for (n=1, 200, write("b062278.txt", n, " ", floor(3^n / n^3)) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 03 2009]
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 02 2001
